package.name: bdp-mirna-profiler-0.3
package.desc: The bcgsc-mirna pipeline was adopted as a demo package of BD-Processor.
package.author: Chi Yang

filePages.name: Execute pipeline from an analysis plan

tasks.name: 1. merge fastq files
tasks.desc: This step merge fastq.gz files of the same sample name. These files are usually from different lanes and the related settings are set in the analysis plan.

tasks.name: 3. sequence mapping with bwa
tasks.desc:
After trimming the adapters, the sequencing data are mapped to the reference genome by bwa (v0.7.17).
The bwa is in the Docker container: quay.io/biocontainers/bwa:0.7.17--ha92aebf_3.

tasks.name: 5. Convert sam to bam files
tasks.desc: This step converts sam files to bam files with the samtools in the Docker container: quay.io/biocontainers/samtools:1.9--h46bd0b3_0.

tasks.name: 4.1 get SAM files from sai mapped results
tasks.desc:
The bwa tool generates sai files for mapping results. This step converts sai files to sam formats and the next step converts to bam files.
According to the BCGSC miRNA profiling pipeline (https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna), the bam files are used to generate adapter report files.

arguments.name: The input folder containing trimmed.fa and trimmed.sai

tasks.name: 2. adapter trimming
tasks.desc:
We trim adapters with the trim_galore tool (v0.5.0, currently).
The fastQC is also done by the trim_galore.
Please see https://github.com/FelixKrueger/TrimGalore for more information.

tasks.name: 6. generate adapter_report files
tasks.desc:
Generate the adapter reports from bam files.
For more information, please refer https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#pre-alignment-processing.

tasks.name: 4.2 Perform multiQC
tasks.desc: This step generates the reports for sequence quality control via multiQC (https://multiqc.info/).

tasks.name: 8.1 Create project folder
tasks.desc: This step organizes files in to the project directory structure  as described by the BCGSC miRNA profiling pipeline (https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#set-up-project-directory-structure).

arguments.name: The input folder containing *.sam and *_adapter.report files

tasks.name: 8.2 Create ADF file
tasks.desc: This step generates the miRNA adf text file as described in https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#generate-the-mirna-adf-text-file.

arguments.name: The species short name for miRBase

tasks.name: 7. Annotation
tasks.desc:
This step queries the ucsc genome refrences and mirbase in the MySQL databases.
The original script, /code/annotation/annotate.pl, processes one sam file at a time. We modify this script to allow parallel executions.

arguments.name: The species short name for miRBase

tasks.name: 9. Annotation summary report
tasks.desc: This step summarizes annotated reads by the alignment_stats.pl. (https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#generate-annotation-summary-reports)

tasks.name: 12. Generate mature miRNA expression matrices (method 2 TCGA)
tasks.desc: This is the step that calculates the mature miRNA expression matrices by the script /code/library_stats/tcga/expression_matrix_mimat.pl. Previous steps prepare the required adf file (step 7) and the *.isoform.quantification.txt files (step 10.2).

arguments.name: The raw mature miRNA expression matrix
The normalized mature miRNA expression matrix
The log2 normalized miRNA expression matrix

tasks.name: 10.2 Generate TCGA formatted results
tasks.desc:
To calculate mature miRNA expression matrices, we applied the method2: custom_output/tcga/expression_matrix_mimat.pl as described in https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#mature-mirna-expression-matrices---method-2-custom_outputtcgaexpression_matrix_mimatpl.
Before running the calculations, this step generates the isoform.quantification.txt files by the /code/custom_output/tcga/tcga.pl script.

arguments.name: The species short name for miRBase

tasks.name: 13.1 Make a graphical summary
tasks.desc:
This is the last step of the BCGSC miRNA profiling pipeline. It generates graphical summary to present feature representations, filtered results and quality metrics based on the annotation summary report (produced by the step 9).
For more information, please see https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#graph-results.

tasks.name: 11. Create TCGA level3 folder
tasks.desc: Copy the isoform.quantification.txt files into a separate sub-directory (https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#get-isoformquantificationtxt-files).

arguments.name: The input data folder to import
The container name for the MySQL instance

tasks.name: 15. Make final reports
tasks.desc: Integrate all the above results into a PDF format and an Excel file as the final reports.

arguments.name: The result folder of DE-miRNA analysis

tasks.name: 10.1 pre-miRNA gene expression matrices
tasks.desc: In this step, pre-mature miRNA gene expression is calculated by the /code/library_stats/expression_matrix.pl script (https://github.com/bcgsc/mirna#pre-mirna-gene-expression-matrices).

arguments.name: The species short name for miRBase
The log normalized miRNA expression matrix

tasks.name: 14. Analysis of differentially expressed miRNAs
tasks.desc:
This step firstly identifies differentially expressed miRNAs by DESeq2 (https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/DESeq2/inst/doc/DESeq2.html). Next, we get predicted target genes of both positively and negatively expressed miRNAs by the TargetScan reference.
With the weighted context++ score percentile larger than 95, these predicted target genes of positively and negatively expressed miRNAs were then collected for enrichment analysis of Gene Ontology terms and KEGG pathways.

Also, we provided several plots to display sample distances in PCA plots and two-dimension hierarchical clustering.
For each condition comparison, a volcano plot is provided.

arguments.name: TargetScan reference file
arguments.desc: This file can be found at http://www.targetscan.org/vert_71/vert_71_data_download/Predicted_Targets_Context_Scores.default_predictions.txt.zip

arguments.name: The KEGG pathway file
arguments.desc: This file can be downloaded via http://rest.kegg.jp/list/pathway/hsa. You can replace the last three characters for other organisms.

arguments.name: The genome annotation file (GTF)
arguments.desc: Retrieve the transcript length for each gene and this information will be used for GO/KEGG enrichment analysis.

arguments.name: The cutoff to remove low abundance miRNA species
The result folder of DE-miRNA analysis

tasks.name: The miRNA-seq data analysis pipeline
stepNames: Organize datasets in the TCGA level3 style
Generate summary graphs for each sample
Perform the analysis of miRNA differential expressions

arguments.name: The analysis plan in an Excel file
The species short name for miRBase
TargetScan reference file
arguments.desc: This file can be found at http://www.targetscan.org/vert_71/vert_71_data_download/Predicted_Targets_Context_Scores.default_predictions.txt.zip

arguments.name: The KEGG pathway file
arguments.desc: This file can be downloaded via http://rest.kegg.jp/list/pathway/hsa. You can replace the last three characters for other organisms.

arguments.name: The genome annotation file (GTF)
arguments.desc: Retrieve the transcript length for each gene and this information will be used for GO/KEGG enrichment analysis.

arguments.name: The cutoff to remove low abundance miRNA species
The raw mature miRNA expression matrix
The normalized mature miRNA expression matrix
The log2 normalized miRNA expression matrix

tasks.name: 13.2 Convert to mature miRNA ids
tasks.desc: Before proceed to differential expression analysis, we map the MIMAT miRNA accessions to miRBase miRNA ids.

arguments.name: The KEGG species name
arguments.desc: the three character abbreviation, e.g. hsa for human and mmu for mouse

arguments.name: The UCSC genome reference
arguments.desc: The ucsc genome refernece (including the version), e.g. mm10 or hg38

arguments.name: The gencode version
arguments.desc: The gencode release. (35 for human and 25 for mouse)

arguments.name: biomart Host
arguments.desc: you may find the archive name from https://asia.ensembl.org/info/website/archives/index.html
